PropertyResource.Description: The colour of the Framework canvas. The syntax is: r=nnn g=nnn b=nnn where nnn is a number between 000 and 255, representing the decimal value of the colours Red, Green, Blue respectively.
The colour of the JavaConsole panelInterface. Syntax: r=XX g=YY b=ZZ, where r sets Red, g sets Green, b sets Blue. The colour values must be in the range {0-255}.
The host to which Telnet may connect
The host's port to which Telnet may connect
The timeout period in seconds for the Telnet connection
The timeout command for the Telnet connection
The font of the Telnet text in the format: font=dialog style=plain size=12
The colour of the Telnet text in the format: r=nnn g=nnn b=nnn
The colour of the Telnet display in the format: r=nnn g=nnn b=nnn
The colour of the Telnet cursor foreground in the format: r=nnn g=nnn b=nnn
The colour of the Telnet cursor background in the format: r=nnn g=nnn b=nnn
The number of lines in the Telnet terminal buffer
The colour of the Login canvas
The colour of the Login text
The font of the Login label text
The font of the Login data text
The colour of the text on a Report
The number of rows per Log page
A flag to control debug messages for the MailDaemon
A flag to control the sending of mail
A flag to control the use of SSL for sending mail
A flag to control authentication during login to the mail server
The hostname or IP address of the mail server
The username to use to log into the mail server
The password to use to log into the mail server
The email address to which messages will be sent
The email address to which reply messages will be sent
The number of seconds between attempts to send any queued mail
